resource.name: Weekly Fort Collins OpenBook Analytics
resource.description:
Weekly data from the Google Analytics tag for OpenBook at OpenBook.fcgov.com. 

Analytics shown are presumed to be non-City-employees, as these data come from computers external to the City network. Each day starting at the first day for which there are data is included, and the URL is either a specific page or "all", specifying that every page in the domain is included. Specific-page URLs are filtered to the main Portal page or data assets, so "all" may capture more pages than specified individually.
columns_description: From Google Analytics API: the average number of pages viewed during a session, including repeated views of a single page
From Google Analytics API: the percentage of single-page session (i.e., session in which the person left the property from the first page)
From Google Analytics API: the average duration (in seconds) of users sessions

From Google Analytics API: time (in seconds) users spent on a particular page, calculated by subtracting the initial view time for a particular page from the initial view time for a subsequent page. This metric does not apply to exit pages of the property
URL of a specific page, or all for all pages in the domain
From Google Analytics API: the total number of pageviews for the property
From Google Analytics API: total duration (in seconds) of users sessions
From Google Analytics API: the number of sessions marked as a user's first session. This resets each time period
Metadata field for record hash. This field is a SHA-1 hash of all other fields in the record, used for validation of record uniqueness.

From Google Analytics API: total number of hits for the view (profile). This metric sums all hit types, including pageview, custom event, ecommerce, and other types. Because this metric is based on the view (profile), not on the property, it is not the same as the propertys hit volume
Metadata field for a suggested sort order. Sort this column in ascending order to order the dataset the way it was intended from the source system.
Inclusive end date for analytics capture
From Google Analytics API: the total number of users for the requested time period
Inclusive start date for analytics capture
From Google Analytics API: the average time users spent viewing this page or a set of pages
From Google Analytics API: the percentage of sessions by users who had never visited the property before
From Google Analytics API: the total number of sessions
From Google Analytics API: the total number of single page (or single interaction hit) sessions for the property

resource.name: Fort Collins UCR Crime Totals
resource.description:
These data are for the the FBI Uniform Crime Reporting (UCR) index. The crime index includes Willful Homicide, Rape, Robbery, Aggravated Assault, Burglary, Larceny (Theft), Motor Vehicle Theft, and Arson (definitions are in each column header).

State-wide crime information can be found at the Colorado Bureau of Investigation (https://www.colorado.gov/cbi).
columns_description: Metadata field for a suggested sort order. Sort this column in ascending order to order the dataset the way it was intended from the source system.
Any willful or malicious burning or attempting to burn, with or without intent to defraud, a dwelling house, public building, motor vehicle or aircraft, personal property of another, etc
The theft or attempted theft of a motor vehicle

An unlawful attack by one person upon another for the purpose of inflicting severe or aggravated bodily injury. This type of assault is usually accompanied by the use of a weapon or by other means likely to produce death or great bodily harm
Penetration, no matter how slight, of the vagina or anus with any body part or object, or oral penetration by a sex organ of another person, without the consent of the victim
Metadata field for record hash. This field is a SHA-1 hash of all other fields in the record, used for validation of record uniqueness.
The unlawful taking, carrying, leading, or riding away of property from the possession or constructive possession of another (excludes embezzlement, confidence games, forgery, check fraud, etc.)
The unlawful entry of a structure to commit a felony or a theft (includes attempted forcible entry)
The taking or attempting to take anything of value from the care, custody, or control of a person or persons by force or threat of force or violence and/or by putting the victim in fear.
The willful (non-negligent) killing of one human being by another

resource.name: 2022 Fort Collins City Employee Base Pay
resource.description:
City employee base salary as of 12-31-2022. 

Starting with 2020 data, in an effort to provide greater consumable and comparable data we're moving away from reporting individual employee earnings and instead provide base salaries as assigned per position. Due to this change this dataset cannot be directly combined with previous years' earnings data. The data represents a snapshot of salaries as of 12-31-2022 rather than actual paid amounts in 2022. Personnel spending data can be found on openbook.fcgov.com
columns_description: Metadata field for a suggested sort order. Sort this column in ascending order to order the dataset the way it was intended from the source system.
Metadata field for record hash. This field is a SHA-1 hash of all other fields in the record, used for validation of record uniqueness.

resource.name: Fort Collins Floodwarning Stream Gage Stage & Flow Data
resource.description:
Automated readings from the city-wide flood warning system, which is made up in part of stream-flow gages throughout the city.  While these data specify flow rates at each gage, extreme care should be taken if using these measurements as flow data; the sensors are not placed ideally for accurate flow measurements and they are not monitored closely enough for this purpose. This is the raw sensor data and analysis would be needed to use for anything but flood monitoring.

The real-time map of these values is located at https://gisweb.fcgov.com/HTML5Viewer/Index.html?viewer=Flood%20Warning
columns_description: Timestamp recorded at the sensor for data after 2015; timestamps were recorded at the server prior to that. Duplicate timestamps may exist due to data transfer issues.
Units: feet.
Units: cubic feet per second. The measured flowrate at the sensor. Incorrect data could be due to clogs, freezing, non-functioning sensors, or other issues.
Metadata field for a suggested sort order. Sort this column in ascending order to order the dataset the way it was intended from the source system.
Metadata field for record hash. This field is a SHA-1 hash of all other fields in the record, used for validation of record uniqueness.

metadata.license: Open Data Commons Public Domain Dedication and License

resource.name: 2019 Fort Collins City Employee Earnings
resource.description:
Annual City employee earnings for calendar-year 2019. Earnings figures are those taxed by Medicare.
 
 This dataset cannot be directly combined with previous- or future- year earnings because it doesn't account for title changes or other job status changes. Further, the data represents paid amounts rather than stated salaries – i.e. if an employee worked March-December of a given year, the data reflects 10 months of compensation for the year.
columns_description: Metadata field for record hash. This field is a SHA-1 hash of all other fields in the record, used for validation of record uniqueness.
Metadata field for a suggested sort order. Sort this column in ascending order to order the dataset the way it was intended from the source system.

metadata.license: Open Data Commons Public Domain Dedication and License

resource.name: Fort Collins Floodwarning Rain Gage Data
resource.description:
Automated readings from the rain gages throughout the city. These rain gages use 'tipping buckets' to measure rainfall; whenever the 'bucket' tips, the incremental rainfall data are recorded. Because of this measurement system, this dataset is only updated when there are new 'bucket tips'; the system searches for new data several times an hour, but only updates this dataset if there are new records. The data rate is limited, so for heavy rainfall there will be multiple 'bucket tips' in one record.

The real-time map of these values is located at https://gisweb.fcgov.com/HTML5Viewer/Index.html?viewer=Flood%20Warning
columns_description: Duplicate timestamps may exist due to data transfer issues.
Units: inches. Incremental rainfall is the amount of rainfall measured just before the data are sent.
Metadata field for a suggested sort order. Sort this column in ascending order to order the dataset the way it was intended from the source system.
Metadata field for record hash. This field is a SHA-1 hash of all other fields in the record, used for validation of record uniqueness.

resource.name: 2020 Fort Collins City Employee Base Pay
resource.description:
City employee base salary as of 2020-12-31.

Starting with 2020 data, in an effort to provide greater consumable and comparable data we're moving away from reporting individual employee earnings and instead provide base salaries as assigned per position. Due to this change this dataset cannot be directly combined with previous years' earnings data. The data represents a snapshot of salaries as of 2020-12-31 rather than actual paid amounts in 2020. Personnel spending data can be found on openbook.fcgov.com

These data are for the contracted position of each employee and therefore don't account for interim roles; the City of Fort Collins pay policy states that the employees in interim roles may be making up to 6% more than the reported salary.
columns_description: Metadata field for a suggested sort order. Sort this column in ascending order to order the dataset the way it was intended from the source system.

City employee base salary as of 2024-01-16.

Starting with 2020 data, in an effort to provide greater consumable and comparable data we're moving away from reporting individual employee earnings and instead provide base salaries as assigned per position. Due to this change this dataset cannot be directly combined with previous years' earnings data. The data represents a snapshot of salaries as of 2024-01-16 rather than actual paid amounts in 2024. Personnel spending data can be found on openbook.fcgov.com

These data are for the contracted position of each employee and therefore don't account for interim roles; the City of Fort Collins pay policy states that the employees in interim roles may be making up to 6% more than the reported salary.
columns_description: Metadata field for a suggested sort order. Sort this column in ascending order to order the dataset the way it was intended from the source system.
Metadata field for record hash. This field is a SHA-1 hash of all other fields in the record, used for validation of record uniqueness.

resource.name: 2010 Fort Collins City Employee Earnings
resource.description:
Annual City employee earnings for calendar-year 2010. Earnings figures are those taxed by Medicare.

This dataset cannot be directly combined with previous- or future- year earnings because it doesn't account for title changes or other job status changes. Further, the data represents paid amounts rather than stated salaries – i.e. if an employee worked March-December of a given year, the data reflects 10 months of compensation for the year.

resource.name: Fort Collins Shelter Service Data
resource.description:
This dataset shows data on the numbers served by Catholic Charities and Fort Collins Rescue Mission shelters in Fort Collins. It is updated monthly with the previous-month"s data. These data are recorded by the shelters and compiled by the City of Fort Collins.

To note when using this data: the Rescue Mission does not have family rooms or accept children, and Catholic Charities does not report turnaways by gender.
columns_name: Rescue Mission Total # of Nights with Turnaways
Northside Aztlan Community Center # Served Overnight During Public Health Crisis - Men
Catholic Charities # of Nights with Turnaways
Rescue Mission # of Nights with Turnaways - Women
Rescue Mission # of Nights with Turnaways - Men
columns_description: Summation of 'men' and 'women' values
Metadata field for a suggested sort order. Sort this column in ascending order to order the dataset the way it was intended from the source system.
Northside Aztlan is only serving men overnight during the crisis (the Catholic Charities numbers report on women and families served and the Rescue Mission numbers report on women served)
Summation of 'men' and 'women' values
Metadata field for record hash. This field is a SHA-1 hash of all other fields in the record, used for validation of record uniqueness.
Summation of 'men' and 'women' values

resource.name: Fort Collins OpenData Asset Timeline - Provenance
resource.description: A breakdown of the provenance of all assets on the OpenData Portal on the specified date. Provenance is the source of the asset, either from the City of Fort Collins or the community. These values represent all assets on the platform, including those that aren't available to the public, either due to sensitive or otherwise protected information or because they're undergoing the process of public release. For a current list of publicly-posted Portal assets, go to the Published Asset Inventory.

resource.name: Fort Collins Council Expenses
resource.description:
This dataset provides records from the General Ledger, which includes individual expense records associated with the City of Fort Collins City Council.

Each year"s data are appended annually within two months of the year end.

To review all City business expenses, please visit https://openbook.fcgov.com

resource.name: Daily Fort Collins OpenBook Analytics
resource.description:
Daily data from the Google Analytics tag for OpenBook at OpenBook.fcgov.com. 

Analytics shown are presumed to be non-City-employees, as these data come from computers external to the City network. Each day starting at the first day for which there are data is included, and the URL is either a specific page or "all", specifying that every page in the domain is included. Specific-page URLs are filtered to the main Portal page or data assets, so "all" may capture more pages than specified individually.
columns_description: From Google Analytics API: total number of hits for the view (profile). This metric sums all hit types, including pageview, custom event, ecommerce, and other types. Because this metric is based on the view (profile), not on the property, it is not the same as the propertys hit volume
Metadata field for a suggested sort order. Sort this column in ascending order to order the dataset the way it was intended from the source system.
From Google Analytics API: the total number of users for the requested time period
Metadata field for record hash. This field is a SHA-1 hash of all other fields in the record, used for validation of record uniqueness.
From Google Analytics API: the total number of sessions
Inclusive end date for analytics capture
From Google Analytics API: the total number of pageviews for the property

From Google Analytics API: time (in seconds) users spent on a particular page, calculated by subtracting the initial view time for a particular page from the initial view time for a subsequent page. This metric does not apply to exit pages of the property
From Google Analytics API: total duration (in seconds) of users sessions
From Google Analytics API: the total number of single page (or single interaction hit) sessions for the property
Inclusive start date for analytics capture
From Google Analytics API: the average duration (in seconds) of users sessions
From Google Analytics API: the percentage of single-page session (i.e., session in which the person left the property from the first page)
From Google Analytics API: the percentage of sessions by users who had never visited the property before
From Google Analytics API: the average time users spent viewing this page or a set of pages
From Google Analytics API: the average number of pages viewed during a session, including repeated views of a single page
From Google Analytics API: the number of sessions marked as a user's first session. This resets each time period
URL of a specific page, or all for all pages in the domain

These data are for the contracted position of each employee and therefore don't account for interim roles; the City of Fort Collins pay policy states that the employees in interim roles may be making up to 6% more than the reported salary.
